children.name: polelength
children.title: Pole Length
children.tooltip: The length of the pole in segments.

children.name: segmentlength
children.title: Segment Length
children.tooltip: How long each segment is in pixels

children.name: block
children.title: Flagpole Base
children.tooltip: Block that should be the flagpole's base (If none is selected, it'll use it's own GFX as a base. Doesn't work with animated blocks.)

children.name: poletoppath
children.title: Pole Top GFX
children.tooltip: The path of the graphics file for the pole's top.

children.name: polepath
children.title: Pole GFX
children.tooltip: The path of the graphics file for the pole

children.name: repeatpole
children.title: Repeat Pole Texture
children.tooltip: You should only enable this if the pole texture's not just a straight line

children.name: flagpath
children.title: Flag GFX
children.tooltip: The path of the graphics file to use for the flag.

children.name: winflagpath
children.title: Flag Completion GFX
children.tooltip: The path of the graphics file to use for the flag when it's been collected. Leave blank for no transformation.

children.name: topflagpath
children.title: Highest Flag GFX
children.tooltip: The path of the graphics file to use for the flag when it's been raised to it's highest point. Only enabled when Stop Lowering Early and Top of pole bonus are enabled.

children.name: topradius
children.title: Top pole detection radius
children.tooltip: The radius of the collider that's at the top of the pole.

children.name: levelend
children.title: End Level
children.tooltip: If disabled, the flagpole won't end the level after it's been climbed on.

children.name: stopearly
children.title: Stop Lowering Early
children.tooltip: If enabled, the flag will stop moving (and the sound will stop) when the player reaches the base of the flagpole.

children.name: topbonus
children.title: Top of pole bonus
children.tooltip: If enabled, getting the top of the flag pole will result in a 1-up.

children.name: endstate
children.title: Win Type
children.tooltip: The kind of exit should the level be considered as.

children.name: polespeed
children.title: Player Sliding Speed
children.tooltip: The speed the player goes when sliding down the pole.

children.name: delay
children.title: Flagpole Delay
children.tooltip: The delay between grabbing the flagpole and going down it

children.name: multidelay
children.title: Multiplayer Delay
children.tooltip: How long the flagpole waits for players to get on before lowering. (Multiplayer only, doesn't work with default animation)

children.name: havegravity
children.title: Enable Gravity
children.tooltip: If enabled, the flagpole NPC will have gravity and block collision.

children.name: requirementmultiplier
children.title: LTRM
children.tooltip: (Leave Timer Requirement Multiplier. Was turned into an achronym because it holds too much space.) Hard to explain, but it's the multiplier for the delay between finishing sliding off the flag and leaving. 1 means there is no delay, 1.2 is the default delay, 2 means it'll take as long as the flagpole animation itself. numbers 0-1 mean the flagpole animation will finish as the player's still on it.

children.name: flagsfx
children.title: Flagpole SFX
children.tooltip: The SFX of sliding down the flagpole.

children.name: endsfx
children.title: Victory SFX
children.tooltip: The SFX of when the player gets off the flagpole.

children.name: fireendsfx
children.title: Bonus Victory SFX
children.tooltip: The path of the SFX that plays when the player gets off the flagpole and is destined to recieve fireworks at the castle.

children.name: dismount
children.title: Dismount Setting
children.tooltip: How should the flagpole handle dismounts.

children.name: useforcedstate
children.title: Use Forced States
children.tooltip: Use forced states when animating the player going down the flagpole.

children.name: delay
children.title: Flagpole Delay
children.tooltip: The delay between grabbing the flagpole and going down it

children.name: invisible
children.title: Turn player invisible
children.tooltip: If disabled, the player will not turn invisible when at the castle.

children.name: winwait
children.title: Win timer
children.tooltip: How long until the level ends in seconds (Unless fireworks apply. They won't apply if the player isn't in a castle by the time it's up.)

children.name: defaultwinanim
children.title: Use default win animations
children.tooltip: If enabled, the appropriate default animation will play instead of the flagpole's own, disabling everything in this catagory.

children.name: bgo
children.title: Target BGO
children.tooltip: The BGO to stop at and raise a flag on top of.

children.name: cflagpath
children.title: Castle Flag GFX
children.tooltip: The path of the graphics file to use for the flag that appears on the castle.

children.name: cfoffsetx
children.title: Castle Flag X offset
children.tooltip: Rendering offset of the Castle Flag's X position

children.name: cfoffsety
children.title: Castle Flag Y offset
children.tooltip: Rendering offset of the Castle Flag's y position

children.name: cfprior
children.title: Castle Flag priority
children.tooltip: Rendering priority of the castle flag. If set to -100, then it'll copy the bgo's priority.

children.name: fireworks
children.title: Fireworks Deployment Rules
children.tooltip: What rules should apply for when deploying fireworks?

children.name: fpoints
children.title: Firework points
children.tooltip: How much does a firework add to the score counter?

children.name: fwf
children.title: Firework Frequency
children.tooltip: How long does it take for the fireworks to fire?

children.name: feffect
children.title: Firework Effect
children.tooltip: The effect of the firework.

children.name: fireworksfx
children.title: Firework SFX
children.tooltip: The sound effect of the firework

children.name: world
children.title: Current World
children.tooltip: What world is the flagpole situated in? (This only effects fireworks set with NSMB2 rules and can be ignored otherwise)

children.name: smashwin
children.title: Win level if smashed
children.tooltip: If disabled, the flagpole won't activate it's win condition if it's been knocked over via mega mushroom or other means.

children.name: smashtime
children.title: Smash Delay
children.tooltip: How long to wait between the smash and the win animation when the flag's being smashed.

children.name: speedx
children.title: Bump speed
children.tooltip: The horizontal speed the pole will go when smashed

children.name: speedy
children.title: Bump height
children.tooltip: The vertical speed the pole will go when smashed

children.name: smashsound
children.title: Smash sound
children.tooltip: The SFX to play when the flagpole gets smashed.

children.name: hitsound
children.title: Hit sound
children.tooltip: The SFX to play when the flagpole gets bumped.

children.name: smashscore
children.title: Score Given
children.tooltip: What should be given when the flag's been smashed.
